page.title: 16LAW AND ORDER
page.content: Chesterfield has a police force of over{350 civilian staff}housed in a modern headquarters on Beetwell Street, since September 1981. The nerve centre of police operations is the{communications room}with its array of sophisticated equipment, used for {round-the-clock surveillance. Chesterfield and the whole north eastern part of the county became one division in 1968.{Panda cars}and {police dogs}have been used since then. {Pedal-power}has also been recently re-introduced on the streets. According to a senior officer, this does not signal the end of the car units but an attempt to get the best of both worlds.{Comprehensive policing of the town's streets has always been the watchword of the local force, but methods have changed over the years.
